questions.questionText: What is the difference between a binary tree and a binary search tree (BST)?
questions.correctAnswer: A binary tree is a tree structure where each node has at most two children. A binary search tree (BST) is a special kind of binary tree in which the left child contains values less than the parent node, and the right child contains values greater than the parent node.
questions.explanation: BSTs enable efficient search, insertion, and deletion due to their sorted structure. Regular binary trees do not enforce order, so their traversal operations are less optimized for searching.
